data.title: Ehh, not as good as it could be
data.text: I have taken my daughter and her friends a bunch of times and I'm really never impressed. It is expensive for a family to go and it's just admission. There aren't any helpful people walking around or showing you what you can do. We went for a reading with the town Pig and paid a lot to get in and since it wasn't crowded they left early! We missed it and they wouldn't even give a partial refund. To be honest, I won't be back,.

data.title: DLG
data.text: Fun toys and things for kids to do and make. Simple Cafe with good food. Erdman floor under renovation.

data.title: What a Surprise!
data.text: The reviews are right on the money. This is a real gem run by a top notch staff. It has loads of activities staffed by a huge number of what I assume are young volunteers. The areas are creative and the staff could not be nicer. I had a 3 year old and a 5 year old with me and we spent close to 3 hours there. The café is small but even that is surprisingly GOOD!

data.title: Great for kids
data.text: They have so many hands on activities. Very educational. They even have live pets to see. Very friendly staff. When your done stop and have ice cream before you leave.

data.title: Great place for Kids under 10
data.text: I took my two granddaughters 4 and six and it was only hunger that drove them out.  We went on a late Wednesday Morning and the place when we go there was pretty empty.  They pretty much had the place to themselves.  I say that because I'm not sure how it would have accommodated a large crowd.  You get the impression that there are a lot of "helpers" on the floor I saw only a few, but they were helpful.  The activities are pretty much self explanatory, so a lot of help was not needed.

data.title: Birthday Party
data.text: Great place for a kids party. Good party room then lots of fun things to do on two floors. Easy to get to. Large playing areas, tons of playing areas along with learning.

data.title: Excellent Museum
data.text: The Imagination Museum is a great museum for children, there are a number of hands on exhibits, they have a room with animals. There is a café that serves great food, some of the things on the menu are ham and cheese sandwiches, grilled cheese sandwiches and more.  They also have ice cream  I have eaten there a few times and do plan to go back.

data.title: Great for young kids
data.text:
I brought my 2 year old son for a mommy and me day. We had a lot of fun. Many different areas to explore with building, pretend play, cultural learning, science, water play, animals (aquarium type...snakes, rabbit, etc), art, space. He loved the drums in the cultural room and the farm/kitchen play. I could see him enjoying something different each time. 
My sister had been before a couple years ago with my nephew. It seemed that exhibits had changed even since she had gone making me think they change up areas to help keep it new and exciting. 
There is a small luncheonette in the lobby. Of course they had kid favorites like chicken nuggets and I was happy because I could get a " mature" meal like a yummy panini.  All reasonably priced. I used our local library's museum pass for a discount admission. We stayed for a couple hours and I had to set a time limit for my son. He would have loved to stay longer.

data.title: GREAT CHILDREN'S MUSEUM
data.text: We recently visited the imagine nation children's museum and we fell in love with it. It is an amazing children's museum with many hands on exhibits and activities for the whole family to enjoy. I just wish that they'd add a dinosaur exhibit because my son is completely in love with dinosaurs and kept asking if they had any.

data.title: Our visit
data.text: The place is small but we'll organized seems to be for smaller children. The day I went they were making popcorn which triggered the fire alarm and outside we all went.  The activities are short and don't grab attention to older kids above let's say 10.  I think I have to opt to look for a more age correct place for my kids.

data.title: Fun for everyone, come on in & play
data.text: Great place for young and young-at-heart to have a fun time together. I will also say that I am a bit bias as my sister works here. Her imagination comes thru every exhibit they have.

data.title: Diamond in the Rough
data.text: The area surrounding the museum is a bit on the unsavory side until you drive 5 minutes away and there's a beautiful lake. The museum is on the corner of two one way streets and parking was not easily marked. Parking lot is not on Pleasant Street. I can't remember the name of the other one way street, but parking was available. The first two floors are chock full of hands on activities for kids 2-5 years old as the website states. My almost 2 year old didn't want to leave. She pet a snake, read reptile books, dressed like a hockey player, was a sportscaster for ESPN, a dentist, doctor, dancer, and musician. She's still too young for the art area, but there are tons of materials to make and take home. Once I finally dragged her outside, the playground is great for toddler/preschool kiddos. It was a special water day so she got soaked popping water balloons and enjoying the sprinkler. The staff were super friendly and helpful. My only criticism is that there isn't a changing table. It's a kid's museum!! Also, it is a long way off a main highway. Overall, definitely worth the trip.

data.title: Great destination for families with younger children
data.text: For younger children ages 1-10.  Lots of creative activities located on 3 separate floors that will keep your child engaged for hours.  Great place for birthdays, they provide a special room and all you need to bring is the cake and food.  Parking can be limited but you can also park on the street.  There is a place to order snacks and ice cream when you first enter the building.

data.title: visit daycare students exhibit
data.text: Good place for hands-on experience for kids. Quite educational. Small admission and lots of fun for little ones.

data.title: Imagine Nation
data.text: What a great place, lot of interactive things to do, such as Sports Center broadcast, they have live animals and an Ice Cream Fountain.  Lots to see an do.

data.title: GREAT Place for kids!
data.text:
Imagine Nation is a great place for kids! Loads of hands on activities: get in a child-size bubble, play different types of drums and instruments, build, play with water, climb, art center, dress up, puzzles, just to name a few! The facility is very open for families with strollers or children with physical disabilities. 
You can also end the day with a visit to their little lunch shop. juice, mac n cheese, and an icecream.
We love Imagine Nation!

data.title: Daughter loves it
data.text: Have gotten a pass the past 2 years and my daughter loves the place. Have not been there since they remodeled but is a fun place for the little ones

data.title: Great museum
data.text: Interactive and fun activities for the kids of all ages.  You get carried away and don't even realize you've been there for four hours!  Parking is tricky, unless you are lucky enough to find one of the prized spaces on the street in front of the museum.

data.title: Nice for the kids
data.text: This place is a nice little day out for the kiddies. The ESPN, rockwall climb, and slide was a hit with my two boys age 5 and 2. They have alot of hands on activities where kids can learn while playing and an outdoor play area. We enjoyed our visit. Staff was nice and informative.

data.title: Fun museum
data.text: There are lots of fun and interactive things to do for kids in this museum. The exhibits are in large open areas instead of individual rooms per exhibit. Parking was confusing because we had to drive around the block to get in their parking lot.
